narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I loved this class so much. I came from never taking a Spanish class to feeling confident in my manner of expression.

I feel so much more comfortable in my Spanish! I learned a lot of grammar and vocabulary that helped me feel like I have a grasp on the language. I was also able to connect with my classmates and learn about their experiences as heritage students, as well as about their home country!
n/a
The ability to correctly converse in Spanish.
I learned a newer level of academic spanish that I feel that I needed to feel more confident in speaking.
Enhancing my grammar in Spanish and being able to learn more about my culture.
I learned a lot about Spanish grammar and speaking. I developed my vocabulary a lot through our various themes/topics.
Improved my Spanish speaking, writing, and reading tremendously.
Greater understanding of Spanish.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Nothing
This course built a great community, and the assignments felt actually engaging and not just like busywork!
n/a
I loved the low stakes grammar work.
I felt there was weaknesses in the course! The professor was very accommodating and made the course amazing!

Strengths: In-class activities with partners, group presentations
Weaknesses: too much grammar lessons at times

The strengths of this course are the interactive grammar lessons and unique monthly themes like the environment, economy, art, and social challenges. I also loved the TalkAbroad component where we got to converse with native speakers (although there was a fee for this platform even though it's required for your grade.) Professor Sybil is incredible and really cares about Spanish and native heritage students. She gives great personalized feedback on all homework assignments that really helps you learn where you fall short with grammar and vocab. She's also a lenient grader and very understanding when it comes to absences and extensions. The weaknesses of this course are sometimes redundant homework assignments and unclear rubrics for assignments, plus having to write a reflection for things that seem a bit self-explanatory.
Very well organized.
Lot's of work everyday, but generally bearable.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes
Absolutely! Spending time with Professor Alexandrov is reason enough. I have such a greater understanding of Spanish now.
n/a
Yes! I loved Professor Sybil and the ability to speak with and learn from students with Latin heritage.
100%, the professor truly understands the types of backgrounds we come from and is always very helpful.
Of course as the class was still informative but laid back at times.

100% yes! I love Professor Sybil and was able to improve my Spanish abilities dramatically. She is such a nurturing and patient professor; she always believes in you even if you're struggling with certain concepts. Cannot recommend her or this course enough.

Absolutely. Professor Alexandrov is fantastic! Lessons are interesting and informative, and I really feel I learned a lot this semester. So much individual feedback! My Spanish is noticeably better when speaking with my family.
Yes. Heritage speakers should definitely take this class because not only is it academically great but it fosters community.
Yes if they are fluent in Spanish but want to perfect it in a way that helps them in public speaking and increasing their confidence.
